pages.text: Using the $(l:creating_life/spirit_instiller)Spirit Instiller$(/l), a $(l:creating_life/mob_heads)Creatures Head$(/l) and that creatures most loved item you are able to breathe new live into that once-dead creature, resurrecting it in the form of a Creature Spawn.

pages.title: Spirit Inst. Recipe
pages.text: You need a $(l:creating_life/mob_heads)Mob Head$(/l), that mobs most beloved item and $(creating_life/fading#vegetal)Vegetal$(/l) as a bonding agent.

pages.title: Hatching
pages.text: The energies in the created Spawn need a bit of time to mature, almost like an egg: to hatch it you have to place it down and wait. Depending on the creature within, it may be reasonably quick, or take ages.$(br2)Placing them on top of specific Blocks seems to speed up that process or halt it entirely.

pages.title: Concealing
pages.text: Tip: The Use of $(creating_life/failing#neolith)Neolith$(/l) instead of Vegetal seems to completely overpower the energies of that Spawns Creature, making the content of the resulting Spawn unrecognizable, until hatched.
